ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: he who purifies it has succeeded,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: He who nourishes it will surely be successful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He who purifies it will prosper,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: those who purify their souls will certainly have everlasting happiness
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed successful is the one who made it pure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Indeed he succeeds who purifies it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He will indeed be successful who purifies it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Prosperous is he who purifies it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He is indeed successful who causeth it to grow,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He who purifies it will indeed be successful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Surely blissful is he who hath cleansed, it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: one who purifies it is felicitous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Truly he succeeds that purifies it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Indeed he succeeds who purifies his ownself (i.e. obeys and performs all that Allah ordered, by following the true Faith of Islamic Monotheism and by doing righteous good deeds).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: prosperous is he who purified it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Successful is he who purifies it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He has succeeded who purifies it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [91:9] Successful indeed (qad: the lām [of laqad, ‘indeed’] has been omitted from it for the sake of brevity) will be the one who purifies it, purges it of sins,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He is indeed successful who causeth it to grow) who refines it, makes things clear for it and guides it to success,
